You can read more about this specialization <a href="https://www.coursera.org/specialization/jhudatascience/1/courses" target="_blank">here</a>. 

Here you can find R material that includes quizzes, assignments, exercises and my own tricks and functions that I created for courses contained in the specialization. This is available for educational purposes.

##Course 1 &bull; The Data Scientist’s Toolbox
<img src="../content/courseradatascience/DataScientistsToolbox.jpg" alt="DataScientistsToolbox">

This course teaches you how to set up a Github account and sync files. No other quizzes or assignments than those related to configure and use Github

##Course 2 &bull; R Programming
<img class="each-pic" src="../content/courseradatascience/Rprogramming.jpg" alt="Rprogramming">

<ul>
<li>Week 1: Overview of R, R data types and objects, reading and writing data.</li>
<li>Week 2: Control structures, functions, scoping rules, dates and times.</li>
<li>Week 3: Loop functions, debugging tools.</li>
<li>Week 4: Simulation, code profiling.</li>
</ul>
<a href="https://github.com/pachamaltese/R-Programming" target="_blank">Github Repository</a>

##Course 3 &bull; Getting and Cleaning Data
<img class="each-pic" src="../content/courseradatascience/ObtainingData.jpg" alt="ObtainingData">

<ul>
<li>Obtain data from a variety of sources.</li>
<li>Apply the basic tools for data cleaning and manipulation.</li>
</ul>
<a href="https://github.com/pachamaltese/Getting-and-Cleaning-Data" target="_blank">Github Repository</a>

##Course 4 &bull; Exploratory Data Analysis
<img class="each-pic" src="../content/courseradatascience/ExploratoryDataAnalysis.jpg" alt="ExploratoryDataAnalysis">

<ul>
<li>Visual representations of data using the base, lattice, and ggplot2 plotting systems in R.</li>
<li>Exploratory summaries of data.</li>
<li>Create visualizations of multidimensional data using exploratory multivariate statistical techniques.</li>
</ul>
<a href="https://github.com/pachamaltese/Exploratory-Data-Analysis" target="_blank">Github Repository</a>

##Course 5 &bull; Reproducible Research
<img class="each-pic" src="../content/courseradatascience/ReportingData.jpg" alt="ReportingData">

<ul>
<li>Use of R markdown.</li>
<li>Integrate R code into a literate statistical program.</li>
<li>Organize a data analysis so that it is reproducible and accessible to others.</li>
</ul>

Course materials:

##Course 7 &bull; Regression Models
<img class="each-pic" src="../content/courseradatascience/RegressionModels.jpg" alt="RegressionModels">

<ul>
<li>How to fit regression models.</li>
<li>How to interpret coefficients.</li>
<li>How to investigate residuals and variability.</li>
<li>Special cases of regression models including use of dummy variables and multivariable adjustment.</li>
<li>Extensions to generalized linear models, especially considering Poisson and logistic regression.</li>
</ul>
